trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Khorvuz has advantage on saving throws made against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Khorvuz wields a {@item staff of the magi} and he wears a {@item robe of the archmagi}. In addition, he wears a {@item ring of spell storing} containing a 5th-level {@spell magic missile} spell.

trait.name: Split Enchantment
entries: When Khorvuz casts an enchantment spell of 1st level or higher that targets only one creature, he can have it target a second creature.

trait.name: Alter Memories
entries: When Khorvuz casts an enchantment spell to charm one or more creatures, he can alter one creature's understanding so that it remains unaware of being {@condition charmed}.

Additionally, once before said spell expires, Khorvuz can use his action to try to make the chosen creature forget some of the time it spent {@condition charmed}. The creature must succeed on a DC 20 Intelligence saving throw or lose 4 hours of its memories. Khorvuz can make the creature forget less time, and the amount of time can't exceed the duration of the enchantment spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Khorvuz is a 15th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). He knows the following wizard spells, and prepared spells are marked with brackets.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Khorvuz makes two Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Hypnotic Gaze
entries: Khorvuz chooses one creature within 5 feet of him that must succeed on a DC 20 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by Khorvuz until the end of his next turn. The {@condition charmed} creature's speed drops to 0, and the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and visibly dazed.

On subsequent turns, Khorvuz can use his action to maintain this effect, extending its duration until the end of his next turn. However, the effect ends if he moves more than 5 feet away from the creature, if the creature can neither see nor hear Khorvuz, or if the creature takes any form of damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm (Recharges after Khorvuz casts an Enchantment Spell of 1st level or higher)
entries: Khorvuz tries to magically divert an attack made against him, provided that the attacker is within 30 feet of him and visible to him. Khorvuz must decide to do so before the attack hits or misses.

The attacker must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature closest to it, other than Khorvuz or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Rhoderihck wields a {@item staff of power} and he wears a {@item cloak of elvenkind}. In addition, he wears (thought isn't attuned to) a {@item ring of spell storing} containing a 5th-level {@spell fireball} spell. He also wears a {@item ring of invisibility}, and carries with him {@item rhoderihck's bag of holding|WorldOfLight}.

trait.name: Spell Bombardment
entries: Once per turn, when Rhoderihck rolls damage for a spell and rolls the highest number possible on any of the dice, he gets to choose one of the dice and roll it again and add that roll to the damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Rhoderihck has advantage on saving throws made against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Metamagic
entries: Rhoderihck has 20 sorcery points, which he can spend to gain additional spell slots, or sacrifice spell slots to gain additional sorcery points. In addition, he can use it to twist his spells to suit his needs. He has the following Metamagic options:

items.name: Quickened Spell
items.entry: When Rhoderihck casts a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, he can spend 2 sorcery points to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting.

items.name: Seeking Spell
items.entry: If Rhoderihck makes an attack roll for a spell and misses, he can spend 2 sorcery points to reroll the d20, and he must use the new roll. He can use Seeking Spell even if he has already used a different Metamagic option during the casting of the spell.

items.name: Subtle Spell
items.entry: When Rhoderihck casts a spell, he can spend 1 sorcery point to cast it without any somatic or verbal components.

items.name: Twinned Spell
items.entry: When Rhoderihck casts a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, he can spend a number of sorcery points equal to the spell's level to target a second creature in range with the same spell (1 sorcery point if the spell is a cantrip). To be eligible, a spell must be incapable of targeting more than one creature at the spell's current level. For example, magic missile and scorching ray aren't eligible, but ray of frost and chromatic orb are.

trait.name: War Caster
entries: Rhoderihck has advantage on Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration on his spells.

trait.name: Wild Magic
entries: Whenever Rhoderihck casts a spell of 1st level or higher, roll a d100. On a 33 or lower, roll on his Wild Magic Surge table. He gets to roll twice and take either number.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rhoderihck is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 22}, {@hit 14} to hit with spell attacks). He knows the following sorcerer spells:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rhoderihck makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) force damage.

reaction.name: Bend Luck
entries: Whenever another creature Rhoderihck can see makes an attack roll, an ability check or a saving throw, he cas use his reaction to spend 2 sorcery points to roll {@dice 1d4} and apply the number rolled as a bonus or penalty to the creature's roll.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Azran's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 15). Azran can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Azran is a 13th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). He knows the following wizard spells, and prepared spells are marked with brackets:

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Azran carries a {@item Figurine of Wondrous Power, Silver Raven||Figurine of Wondrous Power (Silver Raven)}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Azran has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put him to sleep.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Illusory Step (Recharges after the Illusionist Casts an Illusion Spell of 1st Level or Higher).
entries: Azran can create an illusory duplicate of himself as an instant, almost instinctual reaction to danger.

Whenever a creature makes an attack roll against Azran, he can use his reaction to interpose an illusory duplicate between the attacker and himself. The attack automatically misses, then the illusion dissapates.

trait.name: Plane Roamer
entries: The Gradungr can innately cast the {@spell plane shift} spell once per day, targeting itself and a rider (if applicable).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Gradungr has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The Gradungr deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Gradungr makes three attacks: one with its antlers and two with its claws.

action.name: Antlers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d4 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Planar Roar
entries: The Gradungr roars, and everyone within 30 feet must make a DC fuck you Wisdom saving throw or be temporarily banished, like the {@spell banishment} spell.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The Nothic has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Brimstone Mindlessness
entries: At the start of its turn, the Nothic can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Nothic makes two claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Rotting Gaze
entries: The Nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw against this magic or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Weird Insight
entries: The Nothic targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must contest its Charisma (Deception) check against the nothic's Wisdom (Insight) check. If the nothic wins, it magically learns one fact or secret about the target. The target automatically wins if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The living spell can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The living spell has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The living spell makes two Magical Strike attacks.

action.name: Magical Strike
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 5d6 + 4}) force damage.

action.name: Spell Mimicry {@recharge 5}
entries: The living spell unleashes a ray of magical force in a line 60 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in the line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 75 ({@damage 10d6 + 40}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves it with 0 hit points. A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a wish spell.
